definition: book format, similar to in-4°, in-8° etc (a 16-kai format 16開|16开[shi2 liu4 kai1] is roughly A4)/abbr. to 開|开[kai1]

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

sentences.english: Book design of the first problem encountered is to determine the format of books.
sentences.chinese: 書籍設計遇到的首要問題是確定書籍的開本。

sentences.english: Some of Shakespeare's plays were published in quarto editions from 1594.
sentences.chinese: 1594年開始，莎士比亞的一些劇本以四開本出版。

sentences.english: Quarto volumes are too large to fit on this shelf.
sentences.chinese: 這架子上放不下四開本的書。

sentences.english: They are producing books in all kinds of different formats.
sentences.chinese: 他們出版各種不同開本的書籍。

definition: to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
variant of 匯編|汇编[hui4 bian1]
